abstracts.cdata!:
It is expected that the Geothermal, and
            Environment Project - Podhale, during construction, will
            have adverse effects on the environment, following
            well-drilling activities, which will generate solid wastes,
            and risk contamination of ground-water, suitable as drinking
            water, and, potentially de-stabilize the area's
            ecology, and geological formations, risking the intrusion of
            geothermal water, and pipeline leakage onto the surface.
            Noise, and air pollution, as a result of gas emissions are
            further factors which will affect the environment. The
            mitigation plan recommends that: 1) procurement documents
            include the requirement for the drilling contractor, to
            dispose of drilling wastes in an environmentally
            safe-manner, following waste detoxing processes: 2) steel
            casings (pipes) be grouted into the rock, to separate
            drilling tools from fluids, preventing direct chemical
            contact on ground-water, and sub-surface environments; 3)
            site selection should exclude natural habitats as possible,
            relocate protected species of trees as needed, and,
            re-enforce fines collection in accordance with Polish laws;
            4) exploitation of geothermal resources, require a seismic
            reflection survey in the Podhale basin, to provide data on
            geological formations; and, 5) the use of low nitrogen
            oxides (NOx) burners, be used to reduce NOx formations,
            preventing gas emissions during peak plant operations.
